alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 02 at 5:32AM AKST until February 04 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very hazardous.
